blogPosts.content:
🚀 Welcome to My World: Where Code Meets Creativity



Hi, I'm Yasser — a freelance developer, software engineer, and tech enthusiast with a passion for building innovative solutions since 2010. Whether it's crafting automation tools, developing secure backdoors for educational use, or contributing to open-source projects, I'm always up for solving complex problems through clean and creative code.



Why This Blog?

After more than a decade of working on everything from microcontroller firmware to secure web apps and productivity bots, I felt it was time to open a window into my process, my thoughts, and the tools I build. This blog will be a place to:

  • 🧠 Share coding tips, tricks, and deep-dive tutorials
  • 🔐 Discuss cybersecurity topics and ethical hacking practices
  • ⚙️ Document my Arduino and automation experiments
  • 📂 Showcase the logic behind my open-source projects
  • 🛠️ Break down tools I use (or build) for developers and tech teams
  • 📢 Give updates on releases, features, and upcoming work


Who Am I?

I graduated with a degree in Electromechanical Engineering from Algeria, and over the years, I’ve expanded my skill set to cover:

  • Web development (Front and Backend)
  • Cybersecurity tools and concepts
  • Arduino/ESP32 microcontroller development
  • Open-source frameworks and utilities
  • GitHub automation and API bots
  • Encryption techniques and custom algorithms

You can see my full project list in the Project Showcase.



What's Next?

This blog is just the beginning. I’ll be posting weekly updates, walkthroughs of my GitHub repositories, lessons from real-world freelance work, and insights on building sustainable open-source software.

Whether you're a fellow developer, a curious learner, or someone building something cool — welcome. Let’s build, break, and innovate together.



All posts: #yasserbdj96
blogPosts.excerpt: As a self-driven developer from Algeria, I've spent over a decade coding, building, and contributing to open-source projects. Here's a glimpse into how it all started, the challenges I've faced, and the passion that keeps me creating software every day.
blogPosts.title: 💻 From Algeria to the World: My Journey as a Developer

projects.description: The BackDoor of HIPHP gives you the power to control websites based on PHP using HTTP/HTTPS protocol. By sending files, tokens and commands through port 80's POST/GET method, users can access a range of activities such as downloading and editing files. It also allows for connecting to Tor networks with password protection for extra security.
projects.title: Hiphp - BackDoor

projects.description: MyFlixVault is a self-hosted media collection manager that helps you organize and access your movie and TV show collection. It features automatic metadata fetching, local media playback, and a clean web interface.
projects.title: MyFlixVault - Media Manager

projects.description: free and open-source project developed to provide a lightweight yet effective solution for secure text encryption and obfuscation. It allows users to protect their sensitive data through password-based encoding mechanisms, ensuring both confidentiality and integrity. By combining techniques like Base64 encoding, MD5 hashing, and custom character manipulation, Ashar offers a simple yet reliable way to encode and decode messages. Whether you're looking to secure notes, store credentials, or transmit confidential information, Ashar ensures that your content remains private, tamper-resistant, and accessible only to those with the correct password
projects.title: Ashar - Text Encryption

projects.description: An advanced download manager with browser integration that allows you to manage downloads in the cloud. Features include pause/resume, speed limiting, concurrent downloads, and browser extension integration.
projects.title: CDM - Cloud Download Manager

projects.description: The BackDoor of WebHole gives you the power to control websites and apps built with PHP, Flask, Django, and Go using the HTTP/HTTPS protocol. By sending files, tokens, and commands via POST/GET on port 80 or 443, users can perform tasks like editing, executing, or downloading files.
projects.title: WebHole - Multi-Lang Backdoor
